author: DonkeyTron42
body: Samsung already competes with TSMC for 7nm and makes most of nVidia's chips.  Global Foundries (AMD's former Fab division) is technically based in UAE, however most of their foundries are in the US.  Micron, TI, NXP, ON, Samsung, and other also have bunch of US foundries.

author: wavmp3
body:
I'm at ATH with Cloudflare being my biggest holding, recoverint airlines, cruises and chips

ATH for AMD, NVDA and NXPI.

author: 1stGerard
body:
ASML, ASMI, BESI, NXP
Producers of the chip making machines, ASML makes the ones with the smallest semiconductors.

Or go Nvidia and bet the buy of ARM gets through
ARM designes a lot of chips for wearables/phones etc.

Intel, Qualcomm, TSM, AMD and Samsung are main manufacturers

author: VisualMod
body:
>GENERAL MOTORS GM.N AIMS TO TACKLE GLOBAL CHIP SHORTAGE WITH NEW DESIGNS BUILT IN NORTH AMERICA -GM PRESIDENT
\>NEW MICROCONTROLLERS WILL REDUCE NUMBER OF UNIQUE CHIPS BY 95% ON FUTURE VEHICLES -REUSS
\>SUPPLIER PARTNERS INCLUDE QUALCOMM, STM, TSMA, RENESAS, NXP, INFINEON, ON SEMI

^\*Walter ^Bloomberg ^[@DeItaone](http://twitter.com/DeItaone) ^at ^2021-11-18 ^11:52:27 ^EST-0500

author: YeMothor2457
body: NXPI went well. Hopefully it keeps going up, I got study loans to pay!

author: Mountain-Buffalo9447
body: Asm internarional founded asml and besi think also nxp ...

author: CommercialHunt9068
body:
u have to put it in perspective.  u cant realy build down from 7-8 different industrys to 1 or 2. their energy is more diversified then most energy companys of its size.  they have been building this down for years with multiple ceo's but its incredibly complicated and time consuming. 

phillips isnt a conglomerate anymore btw they are full in to healthcare but the stock also didnt realy preform well. they founded asml and nxp which both are worth more then they are right now

but in general conglomerates have a hard time peforming in the long term

author: corti094
body: yes that's fair. Havent looked into ASML for some time, but I am curious how they are tackling Moore's Law. Fun fact: both ASML and NXP were founded/spun off from Philips. Both are now larger by market cap than the parent company.

author: AMSolar
body:
My favorite holding period is forever. ©

That said I hold most of money in IWF - Russell 1000 after selling 70% of Tesla stock last year (after they went up 11x)

It's been pretty crazy I basically tripled my portfolio in a span of 3 years, by picking mostly right stocks, but I'm not crazy enough to continue this dumb luck streak.


I sold fb and NXP at exactly the right time. I thought I sold Tesla at the perfect time but somehow it went up further 2x up since then. 


No more of this. IWF all the way.
